alert.note: Alert for Childress; Cottle; Dickens; Hall; Kent; King; Motley; Stonewall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 02 at 4:09AM CDT until April 05 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE FAR SOUTHERN TEXAS PANHANDLE, THE SOUTH PLAINS, AND THE ROLLING PLAINS... The National Weather Service in Lubbock has issued a Fire Weather Watch, which is in effect from Monday morning through late Tuesday night. * Timing...11 AM Monday until 4 AM on Wednesday. There may be a few hours break in fire weather concerns late Monday night into early Tuesday morning. * Wind...Westerly winds 15 to 25 mph on Monday,and 30 to 40 mph on Tuesday with gusts up to 65 mph. * Humidity...As low as 7 percent on Sunday, as low as 4 percent on Monday and as low as 6 percent on Tuesday. * Fuels...Critically dry on Sunday and Extremely dry on Monday and Tuesday. * Impacts...Any fires that develop can spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is discouraged.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.

area.areaDesc: Childress; Cottle; Dickens; Hall; Kent; King; Motley; Stonewall
